body:
The actual test appears not to be valid.  Perhaps Go should produce an
error while trying to do setFinalizer on an x that is not valid based on
the following restriction from the docs.

"The argument x must be a pointer to an object allocated by calling new or
by taking the address of a composite literal. "



On Sat, Oct 31, 2015 at 6:23 AM, Dmitry Vyukov <notifications@github.com>
wrote:

> This used to work, so looks like a regression.
>
> â€”
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub
> <https://github.com/golang/go/issues/13100#issuecomment-152720230>.
